Class Bulgarian

  • java.lang.Object
    • Bulgarian

  • public class Bulgarian
extends java.lang.Object
    An object that simulates a game of bulgarian solitaire. Bulgarian solitaire is played with cards arranged randomly in piles. The game is played by picking up the top card from every pile, and putting those top cards into a pile. This process is repeated until the piles are ordered like "1 2 3..". It's not much fun for a human to play, but computers love it!

    COPYRIGHT © 2014 Gabriel Anderson. All Rights Reserved.

    Since:
    23 November 2014

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bulgarian

        public Bulgarian(int numberOfPiles)
        Constructs a Bulgarian object, that plays to build the given number of piles. Handles negative piles by using the absolute value for the numberOfPiles given. Also handles zero piles.
        Parameters:
        numberOfPiles - The number of piles the game will finish with.

    • Method Detail

      • play

        public void play()
        Plays a full game of Bulgarian Solitaire. In other words, sorts the piles.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Empties all the piles and sets the number of game steps to zero. Use if the game needs to be played again.

      • printGameStep

        public void printGameStep()
        Print deck size, current step, and piles.

      • printWinningPiles

        public void printWinningPiles()
        Prints a message about winning and the current pile configuration. Does not guarentee the pile is a winning pile.

      • getSteps

        Get the current configuration of piles.
        Returns:

      • setPiles

        public void setPiles(int[] piles)
        Set the configuration of piles to something different.
        Parameters:
        piles - A new pile configuration.

      • createPiles

        public int[] createPiles()
        Creates a random set of piles. The number of piles is a random number from 1 to the sought piles. The number of cards in each pile is randomly chosen.
        Returns:
        The new set of piles.

      • playARound

        public int[] playARound(int[] piles)
        Play one round. Decreases all the current piles by one. Adds a new pile that is the size of the number of current piles. Increases the step value.
        Parameters:
        piles - The piles to play the round with.
        Returns:
        The pile resulting at the end of the round.

      • winningConfig

        public boolean winningConfig(int[] piles)
        Determines if a set of piles is the winning configuration. A winning set of piles is arranged in acending order, with a difference of 1 between each pile size.
        For examples: 1 2 3 4
        Parameters:
        piles - The set of piles to check.
        Returns:
        True if winning, false otherwise.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Get the information about the current game.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Formatted string with the game's instance variables.

      • pilesToString

        public java.lang.String pilesToString()

        Returns:
        String containing current piles.
